Racism in Brazil

Explore films and new specials focused on race

Racism is a system, a way of organising the world and defining who will occupy which spaces, built over centuries.

"Many people in Brazil still say that we are not a racist country, but a classist one. That black people face worse living conditions not because of racial reasons, but because they are poorer. However, if that were true, black or mixed-race people of middle or upper class would not suffer prejudice, and there are countless cases of discrimination against these people, including celebrities, to prove the contrary."

Below you will find specials that detail conversationss of black and brown people living in Brazil, documnetaires that cover the conditions of the working class, and a special that sheds light on current conditions of black and brown people living in poverty.

These offerings are resources for everyone, regardless of rece, to educate themselves on all the ways inequality in Brazil shows up in everyday life. We will update this page as programs become available for streaming online.
